content: * *Drug Houses of Australia** (**DHA**) was originally established in 1936 as an amalgamation of seven [Australian](/wiki/Australia) [pharmaceutical](/wiki/Pharmaceutical) companies, notably [A. M. Bickford & Sons](/wiki/History_of_Bickford%27s_Australia). In 1970, DHA was taken over by the British bank [Slater Walker](/wiki/Slater_Walker). Drug Houses of Australia is now a leading [generic pharmaceutics](/wiki/Generic_pharmaceutics) and Chinese proprietary medicine (CPM) manufacturer based in [Jurong](/wiki/Jurong), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It was sold to [Strides Arcolab](/wiki/Strides_Arcolab) through a share purchase agreement with [Haw Par](/wiki/Haw_Par_Corporation) Healthcare Limited, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) in September 2006 for approximately SGD$19.7 million. It is currently a part of [Strides Arcolab](/wiki/Strides_Arcolab) which is listed on both the [Indian](/wiki/India) stock exchanges [Bombay Stock Exchange](/wiki/Bombay_Stock_Exchange) (BSE) and the [National Stock Exchange](/wiki/National_Stock_Exchange_of_India) (NSE). - Drug Houses of Australia Website - Strides Arcolab Website - Haw Par Website This article about a [medical](/wiki/Medical), [pharmaceutical](/wiki/Pharmaceutical) or [biotechnological](/wiki/Biotechnological) corporation or company is a stub. title: Drug Houses of Australia
